result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly W Vandermark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Must register as a sex offender and comply with requirements.  Submit DNA sample.

Defendant Kelly W Vandermark in court with attorney Mark H Bennett.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bennett motioned to orally amend the motion to Early Release from probation.  State had no objection to the motion to orally amend.  Court granted Motion.  Arguments by State and Defense.  State objected to the Motion requested the Court deny the Motion.  Probation agent Melissa Schneider was present, gave statement per Courts request.  Court denied the motion for early release from probation.   11:10/11:43

Defendant Kelly W Vandermark in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 14CF223 & 14CM522.  14CM522 defendant stood mute.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Matter will be set for trial. 14CF223 Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 2,3,4, & 5 dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include $518.00 costs, must register as a sex offender and comply with requirements.  Submit DNA sample.  No credit due.
